text: I found myself in an interesting
gathering in Brooklyn this week one
involving lots of chicken swinging
everyone was swinging them older men
younger women older couples younger
couples expecting a baby
parents wave them above their children
and of course you had young guys having
a bit of fun it was a surreal scene and
perhaps I should back up a bit I was
driving on Tuesday on Main Street in
Queens when I saw a tent set up and a
man waving a chicken over his children
it was Motty lakhs and he explained that
this was called Kappa wrote a custom
observed by some Orthodox Jews before
Yom Kippur in which one sins are
symbolically transferred to a chicken
each member of the family gets gets one
boy for a boy a girl for a girl this is
symbolic and we sort of hand off our
sense of your chicken and the chicken
loses its life instead of us and there's
and there's a portion of the prayer that
you say at the end that specifically
says that this is in my place this will
be in my stead and in for that I will I
will get to live a long life and my
shortened life will be handed off to the
chicken mati told me I find a much
busier kappa road seen in Crown Heights
so I headed to 770 Eastern Parkway the
world headquarters of the Lubavitch
movement of Hasidic Jews who were
devoted to the late Rebbe Menachem
Schneerson
they directed me to the nearby President
Street where tens of thousands of
chickens have been brought in kappa rot
was just starting after waving the
chicken and saying the prayer people
would hand the chicken to a kosher
butcher set up in the street every few
minutes another person would come up and
ask me if I was an animal rights
activist taking pictures to document
claims of animal cruelty
they said that such activists who have
been very critical of this custom I've
often shown up here in the past with
cameras I met a man named Menachem
Shalom and he told me a bit more about
copper oh I told my mom I found it quite
a scene he laughed and told me to come
back after midnight I did and I watched
them going through countless crates of
chickens the swinging and Crown Heights
continued to the wee hours of the
morning
